rev.comment: this has been extensively discussed - see talkpage; which cancer bacteria did you have in mind?
page looks boring if image is not next to the intro
moved various subcategories of prevention back to "prevention" from "epidemiology"
copyedit, removed melatonin crud (can we have a moratorium on articles from Med Hypoth?), links and references
/* Cancer genetics */ Subheadings; redundant internal links deleted
Date/fix the maintenance tags or gen fixes
/* Complementary and alternative medicine */ shorter head
/* Dietary interventions */ Moved to secondary prevention
[[WP:AWB/T|Typo & format fix]], Typos fixed: tranform → transform, using [[Project:AWB|AWB]]
/* Inciting events */ mutation in retinoblastoma gene
/* Cancer genetics */ restructured section, fleshed out "types of genetic abnormality"
cleaned up phrasing in opening para
[[WP:AWB/T|Typo & format fix]], Typos fixed: aquisition → acquisition, using [[Project:AWB|AWB]]
/* Types of genetic abnormality */ listify + fix link - I suspect a short description is needed for each phenomenon, with links to relevant sub-articles
/* Immune system dysfuction */ added ref for HIV malignancies
/* Cancer cell biology */ trimmed natural selection section, revised malignant progression section.
/* Prevention */ consolidated section, removed 3rd and 4th-order headings (vitamin section may need further trim)
/* Treatment */ moved "secondary prevention" dietary interventions to this section from "prevention"
/* Prevention */ consolidating prevention section, moving "secondary prevention" to treatment section
/* Causes and pathophysiology */ complete reorganization of section (very little change in text)
/* Nomenclature */ removed paraneoplastic phenomenon (out of place in basic nomenclature of tumors)
/* Nomenclature and classification */ removed entities that really aren't "general categories" of tumor
moved history section to the end (per MEDMOS)
more changes to last paragraph of intro
I have no doubt the new date is correct, but please provide a citation when correcting an unreferenced factual statement.
Date/fix the maintenance tags or gen fixes
/* Bacterial infections */ a citation is needed for the claim that H. pylori "explains" the rate of gastric Ca in Asia - I have heard other explanations as well.
/* Bacterial infections */ continue to oppose mycoplasma section - see talk; the present mention also lacks a reference
[[WP:AWB/T|Typo & format fix]], Typos fixed: aquisition → acquisition, occured → occurred, Prominant → Prominent, using [[Project:AWB|AWB]]
/* Primary prevention (no history of cancer) */ Added section on meat/veggie consumption
/* Prevention */ Clean up and definition of prevention...should this section not be under epidemiology?
/* Viral infections */ Added info on hepatitis viruses and liver cancer, lacking previously. Need to annotate with references.
/* Bacterial infections */ Try this, please don't delete
/* Vitamins and prevention */ Added section on folate, reworded beta-carotene
/* Bacterial infections */ previous consensus was against adding this - please discuss first
/* Tobacco and cancer */ Moved to physical agents
/* Viral infections */ Added paragraph about Gardasil
Changed this to tobacco and shift work -- "lifestyle" seems too critical of people as the cause of their own cancer
/* Bacterial infections */ rephrase, removing unproven mycoplasma link (discussed extensively on talk)
Date/fix the maintenance tags or gen fixes
Redid section to reflect primary and secondary diet prevention
/* Complementary and alternative medicine */ Moved ornish reference to a specific diet and cancer section
/* Chemotherapy */ [[History of cancer chemotherapy]] can be linked to from the [[chemotherapy]] page
/* Preventative cancer vaccines */ more informative text about hpv vaccine
undoing oddly phrased and unreferenced recent contribution
Added section on aneuploidy and translocations--can you believe there wasn't one here before 6/7/07?!
/Consolidating environmental section...need section in mol bio about aneuploidy and translocations
Changed section head, attempting to consolidate redundant environmental sections
/* Molecular biology */ Split this section into subsections
/* Diet and cancer */ Grilled meat and cancer risk...surprised we didn't have this material here before
/* Origins of cancer */ This is another big topic, tried to divide into conceptual groups and cleaned up sections
Made the summary more of a true summary--it was getting bogged down in minutiae. It still needs a lot of work, but there's more knowledge there now.
Redacted introduction; it still needs work--how do you summarize such a broad topic?
/* Treatment of cancer */ added link to new page: [[hormonal therapy (oncology)]]
/* Immunotherapy */ added allogeneic HSCT under immunotherapy
moved preventative (as opposed to therapeutic) cancer vaccine paragraph to prevention section
/* Treatment of cancer */ Removed "monoclonal antibody therapy (which oddly was mostly about immunotherapy) and incorporated this into the targeted therapy section
/* Chemotherapy */ contrast with targeted therapy, exploiting dna damage deficiency of cancer
/* Nomenclature and classification */ fixing inaccurate definitions in this section, clarifying statements
/* Molecular biology */ Split off molecular biology into an environmental section
Switched around sequence of sections; cleaned up cancer research intro sentence
/* Cancer research */ Separated section on targeted therapy
/* Social impact */ Added impact of visible, treated cases of cancer with good outcomes.
Removed prayer; It has no positive effect on cancer treatment; in fact it can make the patient worse by causing the them to stress knowing that relatives fretting over them.

Revert to revision 134125352 dated 2007-05-28 18:17:10 by Jfdwolff using [[:en:Wikipedia:Tools/Navigation_popups|popups]]
/* Diet and cancer */ added classic Buell reference here
very important in its community but too niche for this general article

removed link, hospice refers to palliative
/* Origins of cancer */ academic reference for this, rather than some news item
Revert 1 edit by [[Special:Contributions/Noonker|Noonker]] to last version by [[Special:Contributions/MastCell|MastCell]]
/* External links */ rm promotional link to site which contains "unverified research", per [[WP:EL]]
Hope Clinic - added more info to the link
/* Complementary and alternative medicine */ unlink + fix refs
if you think this is important, please add original content - preferably preceded by discussion on the talk page - rather than an off-site page
ref not suitable for this section
Reverted 1 edit by [[Special:Contributions/Redwingchamp98|Redwingchamp98]] ([[User talk:Redwingchamp98|talk]]) to last version by Robin S.
/* Adult cancers */Partially successful attempt to get 'most common cause of death' over two columns
rv ronsword - please address my concerns on the talkpage and await consensus; also removed incomplete reference
italics added - correction in spelling elsewhere
clarified the 'virus-like' capabilties of mycoplasma as a segue to the paragraph on viruses
I listed peer-reviewed research with full references.
adding the same refs as Melatonin article
additions not discussed as requested - please do not reinsert before consensus has been achieved on the talk page
admittedly controversial - please discuss this on the talk page first; I don't think this is suitable for inclusion here
/* See also */ hair for health charity
Revert addition for reasons of style and no citation.

the usual canard - there are plenty of charities who would fund these trials if there was any hope of getting a useful compound (see the vinca alkaloids)

There are also new discovered ways to treat cancer: lay out in the sun, eat squirrel, and drink lots of lemon aid. Elephant is especially goos for women with breast cancer.

rev.comment: Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/213.180.182.130|213.180.182.130]] ([[User talk:213.180.182.130|talk]]) to last version by 209.148.118.241
/* Other chemoprevention agents */ these negative trials should probably go to [[head and neck cancer]] rather than take up space in this general article
/* Genetic testing */ Added information about hereditary breast and colon cancer testing
/* Other chemoprevention agents */ Removed lies about cis-retinoic acid, added references about celebrex in colon cancer prevention, finasteride in prostate cancer prevention
/* Prevention */ added {fact} tag (lots of other unsourced stuff here too, but I'm gonna need a source if you are telling people to sun themselves to *prevent* cancer!!)

rm discussions pertinent to particular subtypes, as well as unencyclopedic stuff about T cells
/* Epidemiology */ Added paragraph about high incidence stomach cancer in Asia
